intro: Vaccinium hooglandii, commonly known as the Hochland blueberry, is a species of shrub native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically dark blue or black in color. Its leaves are evergreen, with a leathery texture and a slightly waxy surface. Vaccinium hooglandii thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests at elevations above 2,000 meters.
